data.text:
Japanese New York: Migrant Artists and Self-reinvention on the World Stage 9780824847814

Spend time in New York City and, soon enough, you will encounter some of the Japanese nationals who live and work there—

197 25 1MB

English Pages 264 Year 2014

Report DMCA / Copyright

DOWNLOAD FILE

Table of contents :

Contents

Acknowledgments

Introduction

1. City of Stories: Finding Japanese New York

2. Pushing the Reset Button: Self-Reinvention and the Triumphalist Japanese Migrant Narrative

3. Making Art, Being an Artist: The Seductions of Creative Expression in Migrant Life

4. Crafting a Position: Becoming Japanese through the Transnational Encounter

5. How to Live a Transnational life: Between Heaviness and Lightness

6. The Pathological Migrant: Failures, Escape, and Weakness of Character

Epilogue

Notes
